oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Rain follows death. The method of protecting the grave. By /han kass o (L VIII.

8467). When a person dies the rain falls, washing away their footprints ('a person who rains'). The people cover the grave with bushes, after which they heap stones 'nicely' on top of the bushes to cover them.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Rain washes out a dead man's footsteps
